skill.name: marketing-strategy-pmm
skill.description: Product marketing, positioning, GTM strategy, and competitive intelligence. Includes ICP definition, April Dunford positioning methodology, launch playbooks, competitive battlecards, and international market entry guides. Use when developing positioning, planning product launches, creating messaging, analyzing competitors, entering new markets, enabling sales, or when user mentions product marketing, positioning, GTM, go-to-market, competitive analysis, market entry, or sales enablement.
skill.summary: Product marketing, positioning, GTM strategy, and competitive intelligence. Includes ICP definition,...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based knowledge skill containing only documentation and strategic frameworks. No executable code, no file access, no network calls, no system modifications.

content.value_statement: Product marketing teams struggle to create consistent positioning, launch strategies, and competitive battlecards that actually win deals. This skill provides proven frameworks for ICP definition, positioning development, competitive intelligence, and go-to-market execution tailored for Series A+ B2B SaaS companies.
actual_capabilities: Define Ideal Customer Profile (ICP) using firmographic, technographic, and psychographic criteria
Apply April Dunford positioning methodology to create differentiated value propositions
Build competitive battlecards with win/loss talk tracks for key competitors
Plan 90-day go-to-market launches with channel strategies and budget allocation
Conduct win/loss analysis to identify competitive trends and messaging improvements
Create international market entry plans for US, UK, DACH, France, and Canada
limitations: Does not execute marketing campaigns or access CRM systems directly
Templates require manual customization for specific company contexts
Does not provide real-time competitive intelligence data
Framework guidance assumes users have basic marketing knowledge

use_cases.title: Create positioning and messaging
use_cases.description: Develop differentiated positioning statements, messaging hierarchies, and persona-specific content for products and launches.

use_cases.title: Plan quarterly GTM strategy
use_cases.description: Design go-to-market plans, allocate budget across channels, and set launch timelines for product releases.

use_cases.title: Build competitive battlecards
use_cases.description: Create battlecards with objection handling, talk tracks, and proof points to help sales teams win more deals.

prompt_templates.title: Define ICP
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me define our Ideal Customer Profile for a [product type] targeting [market segment]. Include firmographics, technographics, and psychographic criteria.

prompt_templates.title: Position Product
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply the April Dunford positioning methodology to position our [product] against competitors including [competitor 1] and [competitor 2].

prompt_templates.title: Create Battlecard
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a competitive battlecard for [competitor] that highlights our strengths, addresses their key claims, and provides talk tracks for common objections.

prompt_templates.title: Plan Launch
prompt_templates.prompt: Develop a 90-day GTM launch plan for our new [product/feature] targeting [ICP] including pre-launch, launch, and post-launch phases.

output_examples.input: Help me create positioning for our AI-powered project management tool targeting mid-market SaaS companies.
output: Value Proposition: [Product] helps mid-market SaaS teams deliver projects 2x faster by automating workflow coordination with AI
Key Differentiators: Real-time AI suggestions, automated dependency mapping, natural language task creation
Target ICP: 100-1000 employee SaaS companies in US/UK, VP of Engineering or Head of Product role
Competitive Alternatives: Manual project management, legacy tools like Jira, spreadsheets
Proof Points: Customer case studies showing 40% faster delivery times, 4.7/5 G2 rating

best_practices: Start positioning work with customer interviews to understand real pain points and language
Validate messaging with sales team before full rollout to catch gaps early
Update competitive battlecards monthly based on win/loss analysis and competitor changes
anti_patterns: Creating positioning without customer research or using internal jargon
Building generic battlecards without specific proof points or customer evidence
Launching without clear ICP definition or metrics for measuring success

faq.question: What company stages is this skill best suited for?
faq.answer: Designed for Series A+ B2B SaaS companies (20-5000 employees) with hybrid PLG and sales-led motions.

faq.question: Does this skill integrate with specific tools like HubSpot or Salesforce?
faq.answer: Provides frameworks and templates compatible with any CRM. Users apply concepts manually to their specific tools.

faq.question: How long does it take to develop a complete positioning strategy?
faq.answer: The framework spans 6 weeks: research, positioning, messaging, validation, and rollout phases.

faq.question: Is customer data handled securely?
faq.answer: This skill contains only guidance. No customer data is collected, stored, or transmitted by the skill itself.

faq.question: Why is win/loss analysis important for competitive strategy?
faq.answer: Win/loss interviews reveal why customers choose you or competitors, identifying actionable insights for positioning and battlecards.

faq.question: How does this differ from general marketing strategy skills?
faq.answer: Focuses specifically on B2B SaaS product marketing including positioning methodologies, competitive intelligence, and launch execution.
